ygData.subject: RE: [RE: [eqbards] How do you play this game?]
ygData.msgSnippet: Um, yeah I ve got a dark elf.  And yeah, point taken.  It did take me a while to find my way out to Neriak.   But the funniest experience I had was with my
ygData.messageBody:
Um, yeah I've got a dark elf. And yeah, point taken. It did take me a
while to find my way out to Neriak. But the funniest experience I had was
with my barbarian. I got on the raft, floated across the lake, then got
lost in the corridor to Everfrost because it was night & I had no lamp yet.
Somehow I got turned around and came back out to the lake. Figured it was a
dead end and wasted the next 20 minutes looking for the way out of Halas.

In my defense I should say that I started the wood elf, the dark elf, the
barbarian, and a few others right away. I've never had a primary. So all
these little misadventures were during my first few playing hours.

Come to think of it, Freeport was a tough town too...

Peace
Evulia, bard of 10 verses, Tunare

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kevin L. Crawford [mailto:Lyrnia@...]
> Sent: Thursday, April 20, 2000 2:59 PM
> To: eqbards@egroups.com
> Subject: Re: [RE: [eqbards] How do you play this game?]
>
>
> heh, you obviously haven't played a dark elf. Talk about a
> confusing city.
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "Webber, Jessica" <webber@...>
> To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
> Sent: Thursday, April 20, 2000 2:20 PM
> Subject: RE: [RE: [eqbards] How do you play this game?]
>
>
> > My theory on that is that someone decided that Kelethin
> should be the most
> > difficult town in the game. It's easy to get lost. It's
> easy to fall off
> > if your unfamilar with it. And it's easy to get frustrated
> as a newbie
> when
> > the elevator you've seen going up and down won't come down
> when you get to
> > the platform. (my first char was a wood elf bard, not
> Evulia though, and
> I
> > honestly had no idea how the elevators worked. I think I
> made it to level
> > three before figuring it out)
> >
> > Peace
> > Evulia, bard of 10 verses, Tunare
> >
> >
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > > From: Harmonie Moonsong [mailto:harmoniemoonsong@...]
